page.title: 03ATTITUDES Changing Times (2)
page.content: {Mr.John Dann}has known{Blackboys}for just over 50 years. "People grew their own vegetables and had allotments. Today most buy their food in shops.There used to be a queue for allotments,now over half in Blackboys are unused. Public houses, which used to be for local villager, are now bars with restaurants catering for outside visitors.Gun farm,which used to sell beer to local workers,is now a sports club with a bar. Bus routes have reduced as routes have been cut.One route which used to run every two hours to local towns,now only runs on schooldays and is a shorter service. Few people now work in the village-most people go away to work.A few men work on building jobs for "Shoesmiths" and some on local farms". (Mary Sell,Maria Hunt,Neil Darling,David Trepess,Jamie Marchant.)
